column9: I was recently diagnosed with ADHD; as an adult female I'm surprised I was actually diagnosed in the first place seeing as how many women fall through the cracks. The sense of clarity was overwhelming. I've experienced very little side effects aside from weight loss (which I'm not complaining about!). All in all this drug is phenomenal.

column2: Sheridan, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for two months and I have really noticed a difference in my ability to stay focused during conversation.  I talk to people for a living and often find myself daydreaming in the middle of conversations and my procrastination factor has been totally cut in half.  I am tacking tasks that I usually "save until tomorrow" and that tomorrow never comes.  I think things are only going to get better when I start therapy.  It's too bad that adult ADHD has become so controversial.  I started to figure it out in my late 20's and before I had some sort of learning disability but was just higher functioning.  Why did it always take me double or triple the house to complete a paper in school when it took my best friend the "normal" amount of time?  Ha.  Feels good to not feel so crazy anymore and to have some confirmation.  Thank you to my provider for going out on a limb and giving it a chance when I was only asking for Wellbutrin! :-)

column2: Stephs2014, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Ridgerunner007, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on Dexedrine Spansule since 1997, fourteen yrs, it is the best stimulant med I have ever taken for ADHD. I was given the diagnosis during 1994 at age 45. The 1st 3 yrs I took Ritalin 20mg x 3 tabs per day. Methylphenidate changed my life for the positive, but, the necessary timing, to take the tabs daily, became a hassle, and, switching to Dexedrine Spansule 15mg in the AM hours, and, having the Dexedrine Sulfate 5 mg instant release, for after 5 PM dosing, was the perfect combination. Unfortunately, GlaxoSmithKline removed the Dexedrine 5 mg tabs off of the USA market in 2009, thus, I now take Adderall 12.5 mg when the early AM dose of pure Dexedrine Spansule wears off. The Dexedrine I/R 5 mg I liked better, for 3 to 4 hrs of focusing ability, than, the current, Adderall or generic Adderall instant release. My deepest regret is not getting the ADHD diagnosis until age 45, because I had crystal clear symptoms since at least age 7, thus, I lost 38 yrs of my life, including blotched interpersonal relationships, job firings, job mismatches, 7 yrs to complete a 4 year Bachelors Degree, etc. Thus I am damaged merchandise, due to resentments. Individual Psychotherapy, Group Psychotherapy, one dozen books written by M.D's & Ph.D's have helped, along, with attendance to some national ADDA conventions. Drug trials with any other form of Ritalin/Methylphenidate, tri-cycle anti-depressants, Wellbutrin, SSRI's, SNRI's, have not measured up to brand name Dexedrine. I also prefer the brand name Dexedrine Sulfate, or Dexedrine Spansule, or Adderall instant release, due to the FDA's non regulation of the bioavailability (breakdown of the med in the body) with generic firms...as regulation of the bioequivalence, is not enought for me, just my 2 cents worth.  The price of the generics vs. the brand name "borders highway robbery", in my humble opinion.

Freedom61, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have several chronic conditions one being chronic fatique.  I have been on this medication for over two years. Before I started to take it I was in bed by 8, slept till 9 a.m.; had a 3-4 nap one to two times a day.  I was unable to function which increased the severity of my other condtions.The side effects have been severe in some areas - but the ability to stay awake, not having to nap my life away.  I am concerned about the long term affects on my mind and body, as both are taking a "beating".  I take over 700 pills a month - about 25 a day.  Plus I take an acute pain med and ativan 2 mg when I begin to have the tics.I am very careful with this med as it has a lot of side effects; especially if I do not know if the effects are from the drug or the disorder.I hope that my information has helped. I cannot stress enough how important it is to journal and/or track how you are doing so you can ensure your Doctor knows everything.Take CareLive, Love & Laugh

column2: A1A5KA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed two years ago with ADHD Combined Type, which means that I vary between being a lethargic daydreamer and an scatterbrained chatterbox.  My doctor and I are still trying to find the best medication and dosage to treat me, but so far I have found the Dex to be the most effective.  I have found that the Dex evens out my thinking and my energy level and controls my hyperactive impulses so that I am in control of my own behavior.  Currently, I am taking 3 doses of Dex (7.5 mg each) per day, about 4-5 hours apart.  One of the reasons I like the Dex is that I have experienced very few side effects with this medication.  Due to a sensitive digestive system, for me, nausea is often a side effect of medications, but I have avoided this with the Dex by always taking it with food.  I also found that (for me) taking the medication with a caffeinated beverage causes intense headaches.  The only remaining effects I have found to be bothersome is that the medication begins to wear off after about 3 hours.  At that time, two things happen: First, I get very drowsy and second, the medication stops controlling my hyperactivity.  Unfortunately, these two effects do not cancel themselves out, but rather leave me sprawled sleepily in a chair while my fingers drum and my mind races!  For me, lower dosages have no effect and higher dosages make me so drowsy that any positive effects are negated.  Other ADHD medications I have tried (and rejected) include Strattera and Ritalin.

column2: DexysMidNightRun, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on hyper medications since i was 4 yrs old ranging from ritalin to strattara to dexedrine ritalin gave me horrible head twitches which made school very hard got in more fights even in elementry got on dexedrine and it worked when i would take it but i was 12 when i got on it and wouldnt take it much stopped takin it when i was 13 when i got expelled from school never took anyothers till the past yr and decided to finally try again and now i find myself wishing i would have taken it through out my whole childhood cuz the changes it has made in my life are amazing i can actually get up and do stuff that needs done not only what i want done i can concentrate now it even helped my love life my wife noticed the differance very quickly i am currently on 5 10 mg capsules a day 3 in the morning and 2 in the after noonish the only problem i have had is if i take it too late i dont sleep that usally ends up makin me take over my normal dose cuz when i finally get tired its too late to sleep but other then that its a godsend i even went back to school and got my ged and am currently in college and i am a 28 yr old male that stopped goin to school at age 13 and never went back till now and got my ged on my first try it was amazing! who ever made this drug should get MAJOR props for it!!

column9: Night and day improvement for my entire life. Where there was no structure and organization, there now is. Been on it 18mos (7.5 mg day) and I wish I would have been on it when I was a kid. So thankful to have my ADD in check now. Dry mouth is no big thing.

column2: Murr, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been through two years of drugs based on different diagnoses like bi-polar, depression and ADHD. I tried Ritalin to start and if was awful so did not think I was ADHD so went down other paths.  Finally came back to ADHD and put me on 10 mg Dexredrine capsule.  The first significant positive difference.  Now I went up to 20 mg a day (in morning), and now 30 mg ( 20 in morning and 10 at Noon).  I feel more focused when on to 30mg but I am covered for only 8 hours.  How do you know the optimal dosage for you? Also, how do you know which psycho-stimulant is the better for your personal condition?

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started off with Adderal which had too many side effects, then I switched to stattera and it didn't do anything for me. So now i'm on Dexedrine and its the best drug so far with very few side effects. I think that the only bad thing is dry mouth.

column2: JillianP456, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have used dexedrine for almost 16 years (since 5th grade) and agree that it has been a life-saver. To be completely honest, I never write reviews like this, however, I know I wouldn't be the successful ivy league graduate I am today without dexedrine. I take a low dose- 5 mg twice a day - which has made an enormous difference.  Dexedrine makes me feel refreshed, focused, and efficient. I have never felt any side effects, besides occasional loss of appetite. I also easily discontinue use on weekends, with no withdrawal symptoms (I do not have an addictive personality though).  I have taken my sister's concerta before, and felt as though it was not comparable to dexedrine.  My only issue with dexedrine is the difficulty in obtaining prescriptions.  Doctors require psychological evaluations every 3 years and pharmacies require a new doctor's prescription every time you need to refill (and often ID you). Regardless, the benefits outweigh the drawbacks a hundred times over.
